text: Wonderful menu options and quality ingredients.  You can't order a bad meal. Very accommodating to kids as well.  We  ordered a dish off of the kid's menu for our two to share. They brought the meal split on two plates with their own separate garnish.  We didn't wait long for our meals, but our waitress brought the kids' fruit and a coloring sheet while we waited so that they could be more occupied.  We've been here twice now, but have deemed this our regular Sunday brunch place. Busy, but no lines or long wait time.  Perfect!

What happened?! Prices gone up, half the amount of staff. We waited ages too. Food was fine, better than average but not better than that. We used to love this place. Such a shame, I doubt we'll be back. :(

Windy City Cafe is a casual neighborhood diner that serves great brunch/lunch. The place is pretty big, but you might have to wait a few minutes for a table on the weekends. There are lots of sweet and savory options on the menu. The service is quick, and the portions are big. There's nothing super special about the place overall, but it's a good choice if you're in the area and your stomach is grumbling.

The staff was super nice. Unfortunately, I was underwhelmed by the food. I prefer my food with a lot of flavor. The food was unsalted... again great for some but not my preference. I had the breakfast burrito and home fries. My friends Greek yogurt parfait was yummy with lots of fresh fruit. She liked the bacon and eggs but did not care for the pancakes.

My friend and I were visiting Chicago for the first time and we were lucky to stay around that area so we can discover this hidden gem!!! We loved it so much that we went twice during our 4 days vacation!! First time we ordered the Farmer's omelette and banana bread french toast which both were super delicious! The second time we changed the french toast to buttermilk pancakes and it was just perfect!   Besides the great food and ambiance the service was beyond great! Valerie was our waitress and she was the best, she even remembered what we ordered the first time and she was happy to see us. She even had our order split to two plates since we are sharing without even asking!! That just added a great homy feeling that you can't easily find in such a touristy big city!! I'll definitely come back whenever I visit Chicago again.

I recently moved to River West with my boyfriend and we took a walk to find brunch in the neighborhood on our first weekend there.  We stumbled upon a humble looking diner - Windy City Cafe, and were very pleasantly surprised.  We arrived at 11am and there was a 25 minute wait (once we were seated it seemed to clear out so you might not always have to wait depending on when the rush comes that day), but we expected a wait anywhere on a Sunday morning.  Definitely go across the street to Big Shoulders Coffee to get a drink and a doughnut while you wait.  My omelet was fluffy and fresh and my boyfriend's skillet meal was delicious.  The service was quick and friendly and I would definitely go back.  Overall this was an elevated diner experience and I would recommend it to anyone!

Whoa?!?!!  What happened?!?!! This is probably my most frequented restaurant in the city.  I have about 25 check ins...and that's not including the times I was just too hungover to deal with Yelp.  I used to LOVE, I mean love their omelettes and the overall vibe.  I was so excited for them to get their liquor license and now I feel like a deflated balloon after a shitty New Year's Eve party.   Been here twice since the change.   1.  The menu has changed...more trendy and upscale.  Of course, more expensive, which I can totally understand.  It just kind of lost its luster for me.  I feel like it's a teenage girl playing dress up...and failing miserably.   2.  "Housemade" Bloody Mary...I was salivating as I ordered it and when I received it, I wanted to throw a tantrum like a 2 year old...it wasn't good.  All of my hopes and dreams that this could be my all around breakfast place quickly faded away as I barely could sip the less than average BM.  So sad.  Sniffle.  I even left half of it on the table. 3.  Where's all the old staff??  There's only like half the people that used to work here...all of the fantastic servers and hosts, etc...????  Where'd you go???? 4.  Can you say...ssslllllllllooooooooooww.  Both times it was AWFUL.  We were sat immediately but the drink order took a good 10 mins.  I could understand if it was all booze but the second time we only had an OJ and a coffee.  The first time I was the only one that ordered anything to drink.  We even beat the morning rush and arrived before 9a.  The food seemed to take forever and the overall vibe has changed.  I just cannot put my finger on it. 5.  At 9a with less than half of the restaurant filled on a Sunday, they were blasting metal music.  We are sitting right under the speaker and mid way through breakfast, asked if they could turn it down a notch.  Server said yes, but I'm pretty sure she forgot because I struggled to hear my mom who was sitting right across from me for the rest of the meal. Ugh, I am dumbfounded by what in the heck happened during the change over!   Even my Malibu omelette didn't seem to taste the same as the old fluffy, heavenly omelettes they used to serve.  Alas, WCC seems just like any old bfast place now.  I guess I'm back on the hunt for somewhere to love.

Love this local gem.  My go-to on the menu is the South of the Border Skillet. I am a sucker for chorizo! It is usually entirely too much food so I take half to go.  They now serve alcohol! Our first time trying a boozy breakfast, I ordered a beermosa and my husband ordered a bloody mary. Mine was delicious and he said his was a little spicy.  It gets pretty crowded in the mornings on the weekends so be prepared to wait! Very kid friendly. We have a one year old and always feel comfortable here.  I have noticed that they seem to have raised prices recently. It can add up quickly! On our last trip, we ordered two alcoholic drinks and two adult breakfasts-- with tip is was $65! We used to go more often but it may turn into a once a month kind of place!
Excellent traditional breakfast menu.  They even had a vegan friendly dish (avocado bagel).  The hickory omlet was awesome!

We stayed at an Airbnb just down the street from Windy City Cafe and ate here twice during out trip. Both times we split the Second City Combo, which worked out perfectly. We both got a piece of sausage, a slice of bacon, a pancake and a scrambled egg, leaving us both totally full and satisfied for under $15. The first time we got the french toast, which was good, but the pancakes are much bigger and are so fluffy and buttery! My favorite part was the pork sausage link...oh my gosh, so delicious and flavorful! It's a small space but lots of windows and natural light and it's nice to sit and people-watch while enjoying your meal. We went around 10:30am both times and it was nice and quiet with quick, friendly service. Seemed to be a little less tourist-y as well. Would definitely recommend this place for a breakfast stop!

Oh man!  This place is legit!   Our server Valerie is on point.  6 of us devoured breakfast like hungry unchanged animals while downing good coffee and ice cold water.   The southern comfort is enough for 2 people and the Gravey isssssssssssss awesome!!  The cinnamon roll French toast requires your insulin pump afterwards.  Blueberry pancakes are delicious and hash brown potatoes are crispy and just the right amount of seasoning.  Eggs were great, omelette was fluffy and on point.  We'll be here again!

The staff and food is good but anytime you call on the weekend they are filled to capacity and can't take orders. I have never heard of that with any other place ever. Every weekend they are like this and now lost my business.

I use to come in here once a week for lunch because it is close to my office. The food was always pretty good and I had a couple favorites on the menu such as the breakfast burrito. However, they just raised their prices substantially. A tuna melt went from $9.50 to $14.50 and the breakfast burrito went from $8 to $12. I will not be going here anymore, I don't think the new prices reflect the quality of the food. For $12-$15 a meal there are plenty of better places to go.

Although we previously loved this place, after having egg remains on my plate for a second time, we will not be returning. Additionally, they increased their prices by at least twenty percent with the new menu printing. I am also having a difficult time with this restaurant listing "maple syrup" as the side when it is really an imitation flavored syrup. The up charge of $2 for "100% pure Vermont maple syrup". Is listed elsewhere. The other should be merely listed as syrup.

Just adding an update to the review. They are rebranding and it is now Windy CIty Cafe instead of Windy City Diner. Presumably they are trying to make it more upscale. There is a new menu which is expansive but two of the things we used to order are not on it (Roasted Red Pepper Benedict and Salmon Benedict. I wound up having a south of the border skillet, I didn't want the chorizo but they substituted green and red peppers. It was very good. As usual the service and food was still very good. I've been there 7 or 8 times and only once was the service subpar and they rectified it. Still recommend it, I just hope they turn into something pretentious.  Very good place. ------------------------------------------------------------ Wonderful breakfast place. Kind of a hipster vibe if that is your thing. Food very well cooked. I had a salmon benedict and it was great, the potatoes were delicious as well.

Neat little gem with some yummy treats! We arrived Sunday morning for some recovery breakfast!  About a 15-20 minute wait for Party of 5. No worries, they gave us some coffee while we waited. We did have to wait standing outside but the weather was perfect and sun was shining so we didn't mind at all. The parking situation is a little sticky and the actual intersection is confusing for us Suburbanites.  We were seated and served quickly. Everyone loved their orders and had plenty leftover! We would definitely return and recommend to others.
The food and service is amazing!! I had eggs, bacon and pancakes.  I recommend all of them.  The coffee isn't bad either.
Basic breakfast food, but very good service. The pancakes were huge but they didn't give enough bacon with the pancakes for it to be a good match. Idk if it's byob but they don't have alcohol.

This place is as good as the reviews said it was. The sandwiches are fresh and delicious. The salads look fresh and amazing. I would come back and try numerous things on the menu. I love Boars Head meats because of their quality and selection. Great place to find something healthy and delicious.
Great diner.  The food is very good, the portions are big, and the staff are super friendly.  Enough said.

Looking for a greasy spoon cafe for a solid breakfast, look no farther. I love this spot, it's right near my house and right near the blue line spot. The service is quick and quality, there's a long menu of delicious breakfast item and everything is well made and cheap. I got the biscuits and gravy, eggs and potatoes. Everything was really good, a solid, decent breakfast for sure.  I am a little sad that they changed the shredded potatoes to diced potatoes. I know it's a small thing but shredded potatoes are the best and diced potatoes are sadly not.  But I liked grabbing a quick, easy, decent breakfast here and will be back to do it again.
Consistently tasty breakfast and lunch food. Straightforward menu, no frills. Cozy ambience. Consistently solid service.

Great little breakfast place. Quick service. Pleasant service. I like to eat healthy and they had options. The California omelet had veggie sausage, avocado tomatoes, and goat cheese. I had air options and went with side fruit and multi grain bread. All in all a really good breakfast. I'll be back when in Chicago again.

A good place for breakfast with all the standards and then some.   It has a small parking lot in the back, plenty of seating even for the sunday rush, and you can grab a peppermint patty on the way out.

Today we went to this cafe because i just to do business we the original owner and he and his wife run a first class cafe always a pleasure to stop and eat in there ,also i know him since the other restaurant the he owned, i work in the restaurant industry for 30yr and went a restaurant is own by Greeks believed they are on the ball fast ,good and service and the cooks the always hired top guns ,the waitress fast and they know the menu,and never Left you hanging we a empty cup of coffee this place is run by the son and almost always went you pass something is real rare if the run good well today was the day for me ,we walk in we take a table no busy at the time 12: 05 the order was take now this is rush hr lunch this is Chicago not a country kitchen dinner i get one cup of joe girl never ck again 12:25 is till not food ,we order a wrap and simple omelet i ask the gay hipster guy whats we the food really two egg and a wrap and is no busy ,also is 3 waitress they suck those hipsters , and we take the food to go which was not that good , son get you staff together learn from you Father .

I have been here multiple times and absolutely love this place. First off, it's right by the entrance to the Chicago Blue Line station, so super convenient, especially in the winter. There can be a wait on Sunday mornings, but I've never had to wait more than 10 minutes. So far I've only had the Huevos Rancheros, and they're so good, every time I come here wanting to try something new, but can't let go of those Huevos Rancheros. Staff is attentive and friendly, and prices are very reasonable. Tip: add chorizo to your dish, it's just awesome!
Went here on an early Saturday morning. It was crowded but we were able to get a table for 2 almost right away. Food and coffee were great - I will be back!

Great food, coffee and fresh squeezed orange juice. The location is right next to the blue line which was helpful and the service was quick and friendly. I'd definitely return to the restaurant.  Pancakes were awesome.
Food, service and prices are great!  My only suggestion to the owner is to bring back shredded hash browns for breakfast.

I love this place,they serve the best food for both breakfast and lunch. From omelets for breakfast to wraps for lunch, Windy City never disappoints. They also serve my favorite coffee which is big shoulders. You will leave feeling full and satisfied, highly recommended.
Showed up on a busy Sunday at noon with 7 folks and they accommodated us immediately.  Food was delicious. Great coffee - big shoulders brand.

Food and Service is great but if you are GLUTEN FREE or have CELIACS please triple check that it is actually gluten free. Would have given it 4 stars if not for the mix up that made someone really sick.

Went here on a whim based on yelp reviews and was NOT disappointed. Got there around 11:30 on a Sunday and had to wait about 10 minutes (not bad) for a table.  I had the breakfast burrito with potatoes. Uh maze ing. I recommend getting it with sausage and do the sour cream on the side but salsa inside. I could only eat about half of it before I was full. Coffee was hot and water plentiful.  UPDATE: Owner messaged me to let me know there is a parking lot behind the restaurant. Good to know! I'm ready to go back and try lunch!

What a wonderful surprise to stumble upon this neighborhood gem! It was a chilly December day, and we didn't want to go too far, so we decided to check out this diner that we'd walked by a number of times. So glad we did! It's a no frills diner, so don't expect to be wowed by the decor. However the food is quite good. We both ended up ordering the South of the Border Skillet and splitting a side of the biscuits and gravy. While it's definitely a spicy dish, it was soooo tasty. The biscuits and gravy were also amazing. I am a huge biscuits and gravy person, and these did not disappoint. Oh, and the portions are big, so prepare to be stuffed to the brim or take home leftovers. The service was great, too! Our waitress was very attentive and provided stellar recommendations. I love that they leave a water carafe on the table as well, which came in quite handy while eating the oh so spicy skillet! The only somewhat downside is that they do not serve alcohol, so you'll have to get your Bloody Mary elsewhere. But quality breakfast served all day is a win in my book.
Decadent breakfast sandwich with bacon and fried potatoes- sooooo delicious friendly staff too

Don't be fooled by the atmosphere which looks NJ diner circa 1985.  (Or else interpret it ironically).  This is the place. It's the spot for a breakfast so hearty you won't need to eat again until dinner, or a stomach-filling lunch (and I love that they serve breakfast AND lunch all day).  The eggceptional (haha!) skillets are a work of art - perfectly scrambled eggs with a savory crispy mash of veggies, and a fat slab of sourdough bread. Tip: This spot pairs well with a trip to Intuit.
I absolutely love The Windy City Cafe! Everything I've had there has been delicious. I can never decide between breakfast or lunch. Awesome service, great atmosphere, definitely check it out!
Phenomenal breakfast! The cinnamon roll was to die for. Awesome chicken fajita skillet. But the service and atmosphere was so welcoming and comfortable! That really made the difference.

Every time I call a rude lady always answers the phone. She sounds bothered by me ordering food for pickup. She's not someone I would want to run my business. Every time I go in to get the food she's also not so friendly. It makes me not want to order food from here. Tip to the owner get a new phone lady someone that's not rude!!!!
Pretty standard breakfast food. The wait staff are very friendly and the food is reasonably priced. Also they serve Big Shoulders coffee which is the best!

Great, low-key atmosphere and tasty food. What more do you need on Sunday morning? My brother is an early riser and we were looking for breakfast before he hit the road. A lot of places on Randolph and the like don't open until 10, but a quick Yelp search brought us to Windy City after a short walk. Coffee: Big Shoulders which is locally brewed. I was unfamiliar before coming here but it's pretty good, and definitely not burnt-tasting like you may expect from a smaller breakfast place. Food: Had the Farmer's Omelet: chicken sausage, spinach and goat cheese with fruit and rye toast. Really solid meal with fresh ingredients. I'll be back and you should too.

Windy City cafe is my #1 breakfast spot in west town. It's a super clean place with great servers and awesome food. Any time we have visitors, we bring them here for breakfast/brunch. I love the artsy/ hipstery vibe of their waitstaff, and the clientele is very diverse. I'd suggest their omelette for breakfast along with their delicious orange juice. I've gotten the buffalo chicken wrap for lunch & their fries are amazing. The wait is never too long, but Saturday and Sunday mornings are definitely their busiest. The prices are a little steep for a breakfast, but their portions are huge (def could split an omelette for 2). Love this place, especially when i stumble upon their coupons in the west town news!

Finally grabbed a late lunch here after living in nearby for many years. I don't know why I waited this long. Best egg white omelet I've had in the city. Nice and fluffy and not greasy. English muffin was nicely toasted and The butter was soft! Great go to spot. Reasonably priced and happy to tip more because of the value and good service.

The food, the food, the food. Yum... Flavors everywhere. This is by far a favorite. So glad I came here. The place is clean, staff is great and more importantly, the price is right. Easily a 4 1/2 stars.

This place is a little GEM.  super fluffy pancakes with great flavor and density.  everything is fresh and portions are generous.  we love the service and that they support local coffee (across the street from their shop)  the skillets RULE - the square potatoes are always cooked perfectly.... crunchy and seasoned well.  check it out!

A stone's throw away from my buddies place, Windy City has been the savior of many hungover mornings. It reminds me of the corner coffee shops back in NYC, with a cleaner, nicer touch inside. I've kept my orders to breakfast burritos and omelets, both of which were solid, but the menu has a lot of items perfect for lunch too. Kudos to them for not breaking the bank as most items come in in the $8-$11 range for a complete meal. Make sure to check their website or the blackboard behind the register bc there are some decent specials served daily. Overall, a nice little spot in the area for a casual meal. I'll be back, hopefully not as hungover as the last time.  Bonus: they serve Big Shoulders Coffee

I love this place. It's a great breakfast and lunch spot, especially for an area that seems to be lacking on food options. We like to go here for breakfast with our team for a weekly meeting to kick off the week, as it is down the street from our office. Also, if I don't feel like ordering delivery, its a short walk away for lunch! The chili and buffalo chicken wrap are amazing. Also, their fries can't be beat- and that is coming from someone who doesn't care for french fries!

Great food and great service. They have an ambitious breakfast menu but they seem to do it all well. I ordered the brioche french toast while the hubby ordered the country fried steak. Both were good dishes and both were warmly received by our toddler daughter. There was a bit of a wait but it ended up being less than the reported 15-20 minutes, which was awesome. Overall, I definitely recommend this no-frills, no-fuss breakfast spot.

My wife and daughter took me here for father's day. I have ridden my bike past it previously and was definitely intrigued by the classy old style diner exterior so that is what I selected for breakfast when I was looking for a low key meal. When we arrived around 11 a.m. we were quoted a 20 minute wait. Given the heat outside (we walked), we accepted it but were not looking forward to the wait. Lo and behold, the wait was approximately 5 minutes. The line ahead of us moved rather fast. My wife ordered the brioche french toast and I had the chicken fried steak with eggs, potatoes and rye toast that was a special. My wife is a french toast expert, so she definitely has a discerning palate when it comes to that dish. And Windy City Cafe's french toast stood the challenge. While she said it was not quite as good as the Breakfast Club's french toast, it was certainly delicious. My chicken fried steak was great as well. Service was quick and prompt. I was charged for an apple cider - which is what I ordered - when in actuality they brought an apple juice - which was totally fine. They were happy to make the change and gave me zero attitude. I will definitely be back to the Windy City Cafe in the future. It is nice it is a bit of a walk as it makes one work it off as they say. THIS IS A CHILD FRIENDLY RESTAURANT WITH A NUMBER OF HIGH CHAIRS IN DIFFERENT TYPES TOO.

Was looking forward to coming here. Arrived 20 mins to closing time & were welcomed none the less, caveat being that grill items are not available due to the hour. We wanted donuts anyway so no problem. I saw 2 donuts and asked if they were within the acceptable realms of freshness - we were assured that they were. Deal. It was over $6 for 2 so I expected a lot. Unfortunately they were terrible. Dry and stale with a cloying texture. We had to spread several tubs of the complimentary jam on the donut just to get it down. Here's the problem: at the price it was an unfair deal. Or it was gluten free which would explain the texture and price. Would have been nice to be informed though. I think it's always a good idea to offer discounts in the last hour before closing. As a result I would probably not go back in a hurry. I just don't trust them. Nor can I recommend eating there.
I had the salmon benny.  It was delicious.  The server Sami  was very friendly and quick.  Great service.

I'd been meaning to stop by here for a few years on the recommendation of a co-worker, "it's so good and fresh!" Meh.  I had a French Dip type sandwich that was pretty mediocre.  The beef wasn't particularly fresh or flavorful.  My co-worker had a Salmon Salad and didn't hate it.  Our waitress was nice the few times we saw her, but was pretty inept at her job.  She was obviously new at waitressing and had to go back a few times to ask about specials, preparations, to get water., etc.  Seems to be a popular place, right up from Chicago Ave. Blue Line stop,  If I went back I'd probably try Breakfast.

Yep, REALLY glad to have this place within walking distance of our new apartment. Does it ever get really crowded? Because if not then it's one of the best keep secrets for breakfast around here. My fiancé and I came in on a Thursday around noon and had he place to ourselves. Our Big Shoulders coffee was always kept fresh and water glasses refilled. We ordered two omelets and neither one of us left a single bite on our plates. They have a very wide variety on the menu and for a Chicago brunch place it was SO SO CHEAP! It's awesome to have a place not try to completely rip you off because they have eggs Benedict on the menu. You can also substitute fruit or tomato slices for your side for no extra charge if you want, which is pretty rare around here for some reason. Good lil selection of jams and what not for your toast. Can't wait to come back and make my way through the menu!

I forgot what my omelette was called, but it had spinach, tomatoes and feta cheese. So good and so big and fluffy. The potatoes were perfectly cooked and they gave me a big portion. I had marbled rye toast and it was all delicious. The service was great, Our coffee cups were always filled. There's enough street parking at it's close to the Chicago blue line stop. It's also close to the Intuit Art gallery which we went to afterwards. Prices were reasonable and the place was clean and cozy.

It really doesn't get any better than Windy City! My favorite breakfast spot in Chicago. It's diner food done right. Salmon eggs Benedict, Cinnoman French Toast , and fries are amazing! Not to mention orange juice that will make you realize that any other juice is just not worth drinking. It's casual, affordable, and delicious!
Absolutely awesome!  I had the corned beef Benedict's and if you are a fan of either corned beef or eggs Benedict, then you will be delighted.  Oh, and the coffee is pretty much perfect.

I've been to Windy City Café many times for breakfast - and it's so solid!  Lot's of omelet choices. I love the Spartan or the Apple Jack omelet, and they come with a side of potatoes and toast. The portions are huge, so you for sure won't leave hungry.  The service is always top notch. The prices are reasonable. The food is great. I seriously love this place.

We walked in on a rainy Sunday around 11. There wasn't a wait but started to get busier. I was really irritated that a group that walked in after us were seated before us because they asked for the table. We both had the same amount of people in our groups. The host was horrible. He wasn't friendly and seemed distracted. They put us in the table that opened up next. The table we sat at was near the door. I was so cold the whole time we were there that I kept my coat and scarf on while we ate. We started off with coffee. The coffee was so weak I felt I was drinking water. A breakfast restaurant should have really good coffee. We ordered the Club #1 and 3, gypsy and south of the border skillets. The food was really good. The south of the border skillets needs a different salsa. I couldn't tell what kind of salsa it was... It just looked brown and really watery. I don't think we will ever go back.

AMAZING. This place has great food period. I work nearby so me and my coworkers frequent this place. Some of my favorite items are their eggs, I get them scrambled and they're always so light and fluffy I don't even know how they do it! I also love their breakfast potatoes, and their pancakes are gigantic and light and fluffy. Their french fries are delicious, you must try them! They have a huge menu so there's lots to try but I usually stick to my favorites. Check this place for a great breakfast!!
My favorite diner in the River West area. The food is good and the staff is friendly. They also have parking in the back. Yesss, I would definitely recommend them!

I popped into this place for lunch on a random weekday.  Sadly, I was too hungry to stop and take a picture of my food.  But that's a good thing, right? To start off, I wish I could give 3.75 stars.  This is a cute little place with a decent sized menu and ingredients seem nice and fresh.  I ordered the Caesar Wrap from their lunch menu.  Their breakfast menu looks really tempting, but it was past that "Oh, it's not too late to order breakfast" cut off time for me.  Thus, I ordered lunch. Location, easy peezy from CTA Blue Line stop.  Parking, however, looks to be paid only on the major streets.  Clean and tidy.  Friendly staff.  There is a back room for additional seating, so don't let the smallish front part scare you away. The wrap was decent.  Not exciting, but good.  Filling.  I have to admit I didn't order anything out of my "comfort zone" (the Caesar Wrap was my second choice.  My first choice on the menu had been discontinued very recently) so I ordered something simple.  But it was good. My only question was.... why are there tomatoes in a Caesar Wrap?  Caesar salads don't come with tomatoes. So, if you are in the area, this is a nice place to check out.  I'd definitely aim for breakfast. Their menu looks pretty good.

Terrible line management upon entering paired with a member of the wait staff lecturing us about the inner door being opened as if she was our parent wasn't a great experience. This should be rectified as I'm sure I'm not the only one who has had a negative experience like this.
Great value, fresh food, and great presentation. This was a win.

If I could live above this place I would.  Although then I would probably go here for every meal.  The service is excellent.  Sometimes they offer coffee to go which is a huge plus.  Their Biscuits and Gravy are some of the best I have ever had.  Skillets are excellent, omelettes are huge, and their eggs benedict are on par with any other place around.  Big Shoulders coffee is also fantastic.  Can't say enough great things about this diner.

Friendly staff and a big menu started our lunch. I ordered my typical lunch salad and it was tasty. In hindsight I should have been more adventuresome. Be prepared for a short wait, it's busy and vibrant. All the other entrées I saw looked delicious and few plates had anything left for taking home. Can't wait for my next visit, I'll definitely avoid my standard salad.
This is a great neighborhood diner that is on my rotating breakfast spot.  The food is delicious, the service is top notch and the prices are reasonable. I highly recommend
Very good food.  Also very conveniently located next to St. John Cantius for after Mass meals.  Food is good and decor is comfortable for a breakface place.

Breakfast is always a great option. A little bit of a wait on a Sunday but what you'd expect. Our waitress was so sweet and very pleasant to talk to! I order the burrito and a bagel. Both very yummy.  Their coffee is Big Shoulders and that is some darn good java! I really liked that she gave me a to-go cup too! Place was small, a great diner feel, quick service, food was hot and everything was just delicious. Soaked up the alcohol from the previous night! Would recommend to anybody looking for a great sized portion of a breakfast with plenty of choices for healthy eaters or hungover brunchers!
I absolutely love this place, from there homemade soups to their amazing skillets. You can't go wrong with anything you choose. The staff is super courteous and attentive.

They're friendly. And everything looks clean. Seems like their menu is always under construction. I've been here 3 times and every time I order something they hit me with the "ohhhhhh, we don't have that today.."  Even though it's a "cafe" the don't have anything but plain old coffee. No lattes, cappuccinos... The plus though is that the coffee they do have is from "Big Shoulders Coffee" from across the street. Yelp them. They're awesome. Anyways, don't come here for dessert, for you will be highly disappointed like I was the first time. Oh, and they close at 3 pm.

Great diner in River West.  It's an easy spot to grab a good breakfast on a saturday or sunday ( or any day!).  The menu is large with lot of options and the prices are great ($28 for two breakfasts and two coffee's).   Service is beyond friendly and they really strive to create a welcome environment.  I also never felt rushed, despite the line out the door.

Huge, huge menu, very friendly hipster-ish staff, eclectic clientele (big table of cops, neighborhood guys, families with kids), low prices, quality diner food (as someone else mentioned, fresh-squeezed juice at low prices was really nice surprise!), large portions.  What's not to like?

My father and I have been coming to this diner for breakfast almost every Sunday for the last 18 months or so. We tried out a million different diners in the city, and this place is our favorite. Everyone there is incredibly kind, helpful and punctual. All of the servers are pretty funny and are great at remembering our (sort of) weird specifications we request on our food. The food is incredible, and is never a letdown, despite being a creature of habits and getting only a few things on the menu. The great thing about the food is that you can tell that they don't use any weird chemicals in the food, and being allergic to most random preservatives, I've never had any such problem with their food. I generally don't say anything on yelp unless I've had an especially bad experience, but this is probably my favorite restaurant in Chicago right now.  They have great coffee, great food, great portions, not bad on the wallet, awesome people, cute location, nice music, etc. It's an AMAZING restaurant, IDK how else to say it.  I recommend everyone to at least try out the Edgar's skillet. It's great.

I've been coming to Windy City Cafe for breakfast and lunch for a couple years now and it never dissapoints! All of their soups are made from scratch and are all absolutely delicious! Everything from the french dip to the biscuits and gravy is excellent. Furthermore, the staff is extremely polite and get your food out very quickly. We frquently get seated in Jennifer's section and she is so kind, friendly, and prompt. Definitely will be coming back for years to come!
Great breakfast and lunch diner. We always have great service and most importantly great food!

We happened upon this place due to other Yelp reviews and we were pretty happy with our decision. The prices were reasonable and the portions were generous. The service was good, but the coffee was just okay.
I can't think of any other place in the city for warm oat meal and hot coffee. Here I feel at home.

The huevos rancheros were excellent as there was a nice blend of eggs, cheese, and beans. Although it looks small, it will definitely fill you up. The apple cider was a pleasant surprised and kept up warm during a cold, fall, snowy day.

Good place to relax on a lovely Sunday.  My favorite things are the wraps, cinnamon bun French toast, breaks fast burrito and their pancakes.  Yum. Update:  The Buffalo Chicken Wrap could have been better.  It was literally breading with hot sauce, diced tomatoes, lettuce and a little blue cheese.  I barely and I do mean barely had any chicken. Disappointing.

I've been here a few times for brunch and also to pick up breakfast.  Their eggs Benedict is great and they also have a tasty selection of omelettes.  I tend to be picky about my ingredients and many times ask for substitutions.  It drives my friends crazy!  So when they were apologizing for my behavior the server responded with, "No worries!  We actually like it because then we know you are going to be happy with your food!"  Gotta love when someone you don't know sticks up for you when your friends are giving you a hard time!

Order the coffee. It's nutty and wonderful. I did not regret it.   I had Eggs Benedict - the sauce was really yummy and we'll flavored. I would highly suggest it.  Our waitress was friendly and overall I really enjoyed the experience.  The potatoes were also really tasty.  The portions were good sized but not so much food that you would need to take leftovers.
I am a big fan of egg bennies and this place is on point. Great service and decent prices.
Simply astounding food! A great menu with so much good stuff to pick from. You will not be disappointed!
My gripe is they give you one slice of toast with omelet orders, esp take out.   That is a bit of a rip off. $10 omelet should at least get you 2 slices of toast.  2 slices of toast = benchmark

I have been a customer for about five years now and I've never been disappointed in the service, staff or food.  I've tried just about everything on the menu but my favorites are the frittatas, hangover burger, and the salmon eggs benedict.

This place awesome! I went for breakfast there this morning. They have a huge selection, lots of vegetarian friendly options.  I opted for the veggie benedict with a fruit cup - nice and filling. They even put the hollandaise sauce on the side (I took it to go) so it wouldn't get messy.  Great service, delicious food, awesome price point - everything you want in a local breakfast spot.

I'm a regular here.  Apart from being the closer breakfast/lunch spot to me, it's relatively cheap, delicious and well staffed.  If you like spicy, get the South of Border Skillet.  If you want your traditional pancake breakfast, get one of the clubs. If you want healthy- they got it, I've just never tried it. Don't get their croissant though, unless you plan on using it as a bun. To clean leftover plate sauce.

My husband and I stopped here for lunch after taking a yoga class at Moksha down the street.  We had a totally delicious, casual lunch.  I had a tuna sandwich and was very impressed.  I think my husband had something with eggs--can't remember what--but I think he got breakfast potatoes and they were really good. They also have iced coffee from Big Shoulders nearby, which is nice.  Overall, a great little place in the neighborhood.

This is my favorite hidden gem in Chicago.   1.  Great staff.  Always friendly and seems to be a 'family run joint' that is nearly impossible to find in chicago. 2.  Food.  Pretty awesome stuff.  Skillets are great, omelettes are bigger than any other omelette I've eaten, and fresh. 3.  Not expensive.  'nuf said. Keep up the great work

Great place for breakfast or lunch.  Super casual food served quickly and done correctly regardless of the enormous amount of choices.  Service is great.  So many other places, regardless of the level of cuisine, could take a lesson from this little, friendly spot. Thanks Windy City!

I came here on a Sunday afternoon for brunch with one other friend. The wait was less than 5 minutes and I was able to be seated while I waited for the other member of my party. The best thing about Windy City Café is the expansiveness of the menu. There is something for everyone here. Everything from the healthy to the decadent is covered. I had the smoked salmon benedict and whole grain pancakes. The salmon benedict was delicious. The English muffin was perfectly toasted and buttered. The egg was poached perfectly with a delicious runny yolk. My only disappointment was that it did not come with spinach. The pancakes were moist and fluffy (which for whole grain pancakes isn't a given).  If you like diner breakfast WCC takes that fare up a notch. I'll definitely return.

Very good breakfast, you're set for about 7-12 dollar per person for a (very) large breakfast! Service is great too, the coffee was free refill and the pancakes were the best american pancakes I've ever had.

We enjoy this spot, quality ingredients, big portion sizes.  My wife orders an omelette, I get a skillet.  A bit pricey, but you always have leftovers.  Their is parking on site, but it is tricky to get in and out of. Parking could be an issue, so plan to add that time in.  Wait is less than 5 minutes for a party of 4.

I live in River West and this is definitely my go to spot whether by myself, or if I have family/friends visiting. The staff is very friendly, the service is quick, and the food is delicious. They use Big Shoulders Coffee (across the street) which is awesome! Some of my go-to items incude the "Capone Burger" and any of their egg's benedict. I really don't think you can go wrong here. Keep up the good work!
Polite yet somewhat indifferent wait staff doling out insipid, boring, lackluster food. Mediocre mediocrity with a half-smile.

Probably one of the best breakfast places I've ever been to. I ordered a veggie skillet. It was very very very fresh, I actually ate all the vegetables. The only downside is that my water tasted a little funky and the the food took a little to come out, otherwise it was amazing!

We just moved to the neighborhood and tried this place last Saturday. Loved it! It's such a neighborhood-y place, packed with locals and super friendly waitstaff. Our waitress, Jennifer, was awesome super attentive and made good recommendations. I had the healthy eggs Benedict and the portion was huge. My husband had a healthy omelette and said it was really good.  Good food, friendly staff, clean establishment, and very little wait. We will be back!

I love this place and yes it sounds totally ridiculous since I only have been to this place ones in the City of Chicago, the Midwest capital (or larger Midwest City in the region). However, the breakfast was just perfect. a) The price was perfect $8.95 (two eggs [sunny side up, home fries and bacon]). b) It was none greasy - THANK YOU! Usually when you go a breakfast places the eggs, bacon and the home fries swim in grease. Not at Windy City Café. THANK YOU for not doing that. The taste was just perfect, none greasy eggs, bacon and home fries - what a relieve from all other places I have been before (incl. out of state places). Besides, I highly recommend the whole wheat toast, yummy, yummy. A crispy, full crust covered with sesame seed that was served without butter...again THANK YOU! I hate when the bread is covered with butter and on the end you have a soaked piece of bread on your plate.  Service was great, very attentive and friendly.  It is out of city centre but it is worth the walk or train/bus ride since the atmosphere is local and totally relaxed. Show-up in sweat pans/ long pyjama bottoms (please wear long pans) you will not feel out of place. I will be back and PLEASE Windy City Café keep your less grease policy.

Best huevos rancheros I've ever had: great green salsa on top, just hot enough; no rice so I get more refried beans (yay) and a chopped salsa of tomatoes-red onion-cilantro.  Even a particular eater in the group liked his chicken fajita skillet breakfast. Very very friendly waitress. (sshh: free street parking)
A great breakfast spot. Great food prepared with care and amazing multigrain toast. Very reasonable prices and clean.

My favorite neighborhood go-to breakfast spot. The service is always friendly and quick and has a nice clean, bright atmosphere with pictures of old Chicago days gone by on the walls. While my husband I don't have kids (yet!), this is a very family-friendly, vibrant place.  We frequent this place on early weekend mornings. We always order the mozzarella sticks (yes, even at 8 a.m.) and either share the tuna melt or get the Health Club (cottage cheese, fruit and veggies, poached eggs, and an English muffin, add cream cheese, please!).  They serve Big Shoulders coffee here, which is a little strong and bitter for my taste, but I can doctor it up with cream and sugar.  I really enjoy having this place in my neighborhood.

Windy City Cafe, y u never disappoint?  Friendly staff and always quick service. My only suggestion is to stay away from the Sunday church rush. Other than that, I never have a problem getting a seat.
Ordered a breakfast sandwich.   It's nothing to write home about.   The english muffin wasn't even toasted.   I won't be back, the traffic isn't worth it.

Love this place!  The staff is amazing. The food is always spot on and the friendliness can't be beat.  I dine at Windy City once every week or two and I would encourage anyone to enjoy all of their offerings.  A+

Went to brunch here after Pilates at West Town Pilates, and it was absolutely amazing! While the place doesn't seem huge upon entry, there is a second room around the corner that allow for more seating and has several booths.  The potions were generous but not too huge, and the price was excellent! Our server was polite, attentive, and offered various suggestions and modifications to accommodate the diets of our group.  The huevos rancheros was prepared very well, with the eggs not too runny, and just enough salsa verde. The biscuits and gravy were not soggy or mushy, but also not dry, which seems to be a challenge for some other restaurants.  Th coffee was also delicious, and is roasted just across the street, and the servers were quick to fill an empty mug.  I would definitely go again, and would recommend to a friend/family member.

This place is just walking distance from me and I love it. The people that work in this great diner are always so friendly and accommodating. I usually order the Number 3 half order of french toast, eggs, sausage and my coffee. However my boyfriend ordered a breakfast skillet and that was the bomb! Those potatoes that came in his skillet were made to perfection and that ham was marvelous! I wanted to almost exchange my dish. But nahh, all just come back and order that instead! :-D
Super friendly service, delicious food (and a massive menu), cosy and bright atmosphere. And my coffee cup was never half empty before a top-off was offered.  Great place all around.

Update: After more and more visits we continue to love this place. Great wait staff that seems to stick around in the long term. My favorite is the buffalo chicken wrap - best in the city.  This place is very consistent in their quality of service and food. One of my favorites in the city.  Great selection (HUGE menu) and good service.  Had the Farmer's Omelet and it was absolutely delish.  Just the right amount of goat's cheese with spinach and chicken sausage.  I was pleasantly surprised with the side of fruit as it was fresh and had better types of fruit than other breakfast places.  My boyfriend loved the buffalo chicken wrap.  Great coffee.  Definitely coming back.

Had a great Apple Jack burger and my friend had the Rueben. Ross was our server and he was attentive and a little sassy, making our lunch there a fun experience. Great portion size for the money. Clean place with a bright fun atmosphere.
Food is good. I live down the street but don't come too often. I recommend this place to anyone in the area.

My family and I have dined here 2x, and we'll be back for more! My son recently moved to the Ukranian Village and several times a month, I visit him. Our 1st experience with Windy City was noteworthy. Our server, Mujju was informative and attentive. The food quality was superior to other cafes/diners. I told our waiter I had to pay for parking on the street, cause the Cafe is located on one of those weird 6 corners of Chicago. He informed us that parking parallel to the diner was allowed and free and they had a private lot in the back. Good tip! This past weekend, we had the opportunity to dine at Windy City for a 2nd time....yeah! Parked in their private free lot... yeah, again! This time we arrived at the height of Sunday Brunch, 12/noon. Not to panic, the Host was like a orchestra conductor. He took names, watched when guests would leave, so he could clear the table(s) for the next guests, processed payments, and basically pitched in where help was needed. Gotta say, when you have a line of hungry guests at your door, I appreciate the extra effort a Host helps his team. Our waiter, Ross H. was awesome! Friendly, attentive and a sense of humor. Windy City changes their menu with the seasons, which keeps the family owned business interesting and you want to return for more. Our favs are the South of the Border skillet and anything with corned beef hash.

This is a pretty solid breakfast spot. I had a Spinach, Bacon & Cheddar omelet with potatoes(very good), toast and Big Shoulders coffee. It gets pretty busy pretty fast. The service is friendly and the prices are reasonable. It's in a pretty good location too for those on public transit.

You can find me here at least twice a month on a weekend morning and although it is always crowded, I've never waited more than 10 minutes for a table. Everything I've ordered has been wonderful and the service is always excellent (coffees and waters always filled).

Great place for breakfast.  We were visiting and wanted to stop by a place before jumping on the highway.  Better value than eating downtown without sacrificing quality and quantity.  I had an egg white omelette with chicken, mushroom, broccoli and cheese...excellent.  Kids and wife also loved their food.

I took my mom here for a birthday brunch yesterday and we were both very pleased with the food. This is saying a lot because my mom is literally one of the judgiest (I know it's not a real word, but I need to use it here. lol) eaters on planet earth. She had the Edgar's skillet which is packed full of meat and cheese. I stole a few bites and was jealous that I didn't pick it as my meal. I had the omelet that was on special that day (forgot the name, sorry). It had avocados, spinach, cheese and applewood smoked bacon. Needed a pinch of salt but was extremely tasty with fresh ingredients. It comes with potatoes and a side of toast but I passed on the toast since mom and I decided to split a half order or french toast. The french toast was easily the highlight of the meal. You don't need too much syrup, they were moist and SO flavorful. I enjoyed every bite. The half order comes with two slices cut into four and it was more than enough for my mom and me to split with our entrees. The service was good, our server was very friendly and he was wearing a hilarious Christmas sweater that said "All I want for Christmas is Beyonce". Minus one star for the small space in the front with virtually no waiting area and my slightly cold potatoes. Despite the minor issues I liked the atmosphere and will definitely be back!

My boyfriend and I love Windy City! We come in at least once a week. Today, we had a very good experience. They were extremely busy and it was noon on a Sunday... Now I will say that the service is usually very fast but today they were a bit slammed. Our food took longer than normal, but we received it fast enough and it was hot and delicious. A woman (not our waitress, but seemed like a manager) gave us our check and gave us a 50% discount for the long wait. That kind of service rarely happens, we were quite surprised!! The longer than normal wait today will absolutely not affect our loyalty to this great neighborhood diner!!! If you're still reading this, try the biscuits and gravy! ;)
Great food for a great price and friendly service. I recommend the huevos rancheros, but you can also piece together a great meal from the list of sides.

First time there and we loved it. My boyfriend had the Ole Omelette: Chorizo Sausage, Jalapeños, Onions,  and Cheddar Cheese, while I ordered the December special: Brioche french toast dipped in a cinnamon and eggnog batter with pecans and cinnamon butter. Everything was great down to the BIg Shoulders coffee they serve.  It was fantastic and didn't have to wait an hour + to be seated - not to say the place wasn't packed, just a hidden gem in west town.   So worth and can't wait to go back to have lunch there as the looked incredible. Great staff, great food and great price (for two breakfast entrees, 2 coffees and a mexican hot chocolate it was just under $25 without tip).  Happily will return again and again!

Growing up and now living as an adult in this neighborhood, I've really tried to give this place plenty of chances. While the food is generally good, it lacks many diner qualities.  Cons:  -The service is slow. Don't think you can order out either because you'll wait just as long. -I've had my order mixed up on my last three visits now.  -The prices are pretty higher for a diner. $6 for a bowl a soup? $12 for an omelet? For that price I'll go to Summer House.  Pros: -As I mentioned, the food generally tastes good -Friendly wait staff

The spartan omelet is amazing and I love the quartered potatoes, I was a little surprised they only gave a single piece of wheat toast, then I tasted the bread and now I'm more upset I didn't get two pieces because the bread is awesome also. Thanks!

A wonderful, cozy place for breakfast! I enjoyed my Egg Benedict and pumpkin pancake. Even though the egg was more well cooked than what I expected for Egg Benedict, but it works. Just a nice place to be for breakfast... plus, the music selection is nice as well. :)

My boyfriend and I were in Chicago for a long weekend. He ate here 3 of the 4 mornings and would always bring back some leftovers because they serve a lot of food. On the last morning we went together because I just had to try the pumpkin pancakes he told me about (but didn't bring back). This morning he had the biscuits and gravy for a second time. He was very impressed and said they truly tasted like 'southern' biscuits and gravy. The omelettes are quite large and very fluffy. And I had the pumpkin pancakes. They were amazing!  Two cakes sprinkled lightly with cinnamon and sugar and drizzled with caramel sauce. There were sides of whipped cream, syrup,  and cranberry sauce.  Then let's talk about the friendly wait staff!  Ross waited on is this morning. And he has been there for about 2.5 years. Vicki was also there. She came over and we discussed the pancakes and they talked about the previous mornings he was in there. You would think we were long-time regulars that have been coming to the diner that we can walk in and they know our order. I will be back the next time I visit Chicago...even if I have to commute to get here!
Always come here to eat breakfast and the food is always perfect  I highly recommend this place to anybody, five stars for this place.

Overall:great place for a low key brunch Likes: - Very friendly service, clearly passionate about their food - Big Shoulders coffee! - Expansive breakfast and lunch menu Gripes: - Very little ambiance - No reservations, but typically not a bad wait time

We came here for awhile a few years ago, but stopped coming because the salsa with the breakfast burrito was TOO hot (and I like hot!--go figure).  They had no other options.  Recently, my hubby wanted to go back when we got tired of our other breakfast places.  Wow!!!!  It was like a transformation!  The menu is the same, but the kitchen must be different.  We're loving this place now!  In addition, they have a great waitstaff.  We only go there once a week, but after a couple of times they seem to remember you.  They will recommend things and tell you things that let you know that they actually eat there.  This is an excellent sign!  They are also changing things around on their menu, which is also good.  As long as they keep current with the customers, this will be a keeper.  The  quality is great, the place is warm, inviting and clean, and the service is terrific.  We highly recommend!

Had the chicken sandwich on ciabatta bread with seasoned fries. Large portions of good food.  Mushroom and brie soup was suprisingly delicious and original. Friendly and cozy atmosphere, lots of regulars seem to frequent.

Our first choice for breakfast had a hour long wait for a seat of two. Came across here and decided to give it a try. The place had a good amount of people in there. From old couples to families to just people eating by themselves and the environment was great! Decided to get some pancakes and boy were they bigger than expected. Got some fresh lemonade it was perfect. Expect me back very soon!

My job is right down the street so I frequent this place often. The food is tasty, diner style American food. Everything tastes fresh and the service and prices are both decent. This is my go to sit down place whenever my coworkers and I are sick of eating subway (which is about once a week!)  I have ordered burgers, and panini, soup and I will try the cobb salad this week! I want to try the breakfast items soon too.  I really like the wait staff, everyone is energetic and friendly.  I also learned that they make every sauce in house except the ketchup. The BBQ sauce is pretty good!  The waiter informed me that there are more than 60 different options in the computer to add, take away, extra, light whatever you want on your food. Sometimes there are slight up charges for extra something but to me it is worth it to get what you actually want as opposed to the 'no substitutions' ideology found at some restaurants.

Came in for very late breakfast 45 minutes before closing.  We were cheerfully greeted, and our late breakfast omelette a were prepared to order perfectly!! I love the fluffy moist egg white (up charge $1.50 for egg whites only) omelets here!!! They were out of mushrooms so we were allowed to request a substitute vegetable. Found out that Windy City Cafe has over 30 kinds of bread, including marble rye and multigrain, you can choose for your toast! No up charge for tomato slices or a 1/2 cup of fresh fruit instead of potatoes with your eggs!! Love this. The husband's omelet was soft without brown edges anywhere, just the way he likes it!  I love not listening to, 'No one can properly cook eggs anymore! The test of a good chef is how well the eggs are cooked.' while trying to enjoy my meal! Lovely and on a tropical Chicago Monday afternoon. Now, that's how I like it!!!!

Great servers. Ordered the french dip which was not good....too bland. My colleagues fot the buffalo wrap and other wraps which seemed more interesting.   Dont order the french dip sandwich. Not my preference.  Our server was super nice and welcoming.
The smoked salmon omelette was so good! It's a simple cafe not too much decor with good service and good food for a decent price, I will be coming back again.

Cute, little cafe. I came here with my boyfriend for brunch. I ordered a special, which was an omelet with spinach, ham, mushrooms, pepper jack cheese (I think), green bell peppers, and some other stuff (if I remember correctly). My boyfriend got a skillet (don't remember which one, sorry! I'll update when I find out). Both of our meals were absolutely delicious and the portions were pretty large. The meals came with a side of toast, and mine came with hash browns. Everything was tasty and extremely filling. Our server was nice, but kind of impersonal, I don't remember much about her, because she didn't talk much. But hey, I'm not there to make new friends; I'm there to eat, so I wont' hold that against her. Overall, pretty good. I'll be back!

I cannot get enough of Windy City Cafe! Their food is delicious and affordable. Definitely try any of the skillets especially the "South of the border" skillet! It can definitely be difficult to get a seat on a Sunday afternoon but its worth the wait. If you order to-go you normally don't have to wait more than 20 minutes. The wait staff is very nice even with so many tables to manager. There is a small parking lot in the back or paid street parking on the side. You can also get there right off the blue line Chicago stop. This is a brunch spot that you don't want to miss!

The server could not answer any of my questions.  I ordered the special, banana split pancakes, but requested no pecans.  I was not served water or asked if I wanted anything to drink.  30 minutes later, my pancakes came out with pecans.  Although he did not check in, the guy behind the counter (super kind and well-informed = one star) did and whisked my order away to regenerate it correctly and also brought me a glass of water.  The second iteration had no toppings on it (which were half its appeal).  I mentioned this and they brought them on the side. The pancakes were really dry despite a generous dousing of chocolate and strawberry syrup.  I tried to choke it down with water, but my small glass never got refilled.  I left somewhat hungry and really thirsty.  An additional star for giving me a small discount for having messed up my order.  That was considerate.  I won't be back.

Great cafe food, horrible coffee.  I live in the Industrial Corridor(River West) so I am all about keeping my dining experiences local and I would eat here much more, however, their coffee is very bad.  It is Big Shoulders Coffee, which is an Industrial Corridor cafe, it is just awful coffee,  very very bitter and undrinkable.  I suggest take out or lunch from here as the coffee is their worst feature

Went before pride parade. I had the brioche French toast. It was pretty cooked. Dry. I tried my friends turkey sausage and biscuits and gravy - now that was good. I obviously got the wrong dish. I would go back but get something else. Good service and yummy coffee. Large extensive menu. Very little wait for a Sunday brunch.

I decided to try Windy City cafe this morning for breakfast and was not disappointed. The sunrise omelet was delicious, it had spinach, goat cheese and tomato; I ordered the fruit and whole wheat toast as sides and they were also tasty. The service was friendly and they serve great portion sizes for the price. I would definitely suggest stopping by for some good breakfast food if you're in the area!
We come here often for a weekend brunch.   The food and service is always really good.  I have done carryout a few times and it has always been great as well.

This place is an awesome spot for breakfast and lunch. the food is great, staff is friendly and professional, and you can't beat the price. I love everything that I've ever ordered here... so check it out. they have free parking in the back and their new signs and window graphics look fantastic.

If you are looking for diner-style breakfast, brunch, or lunch you will be making a good choice if you go here.  The service is always excellent.  They make a mighty fine breakfast burrito and their lunch items are delicious as well.

Tried this place over the weekend.  The food was just ok- I dont know if I ordered the wrong thing (B&G) but I figured you cant screw that up.  It was just ok- nothing to write home... or yelp about.  I hope the next time I go back, it will change my mind.

Really enjoyed this place! We have lived down the street for 3 years and have never stopped in. We have been wanting a traditional breakfast cafe to call our own but have been lost amidst all of the new age fancy places the city has to offer. We were served ice cold water immediately, the coffee was on point, our omelets came extremely fast and were tasty with plenty of ingredients, the side of fruit was made of an array of fresh items and I was so impressed. The setting was cozy and clean, the playlist was soothing and made of latest indie hits, they offered us to take our coffee to go and a regular named Peter greeted us from the corner. Again, perfect little cafe to celebrate this first real day of spring!

Love this place! I used to love right around the corner and it was my go-to, but since moving I haven't been in a while.. But I recently had brunch with a friend and between it's perfect location, parking in back!! And the friendly service and good food- It's awesome! Just a great, fresh, local staple. :)

Happened to be in the neighborhood by accident, as our plan "A" breakfast place was closed so we wandered onto "Windy City".  What an absolute delightful surprise!  My wife and I started out with a cup of their marvelous coffee from "Big Shoulders" and freshly squeezed OJ, that was the best I had in years!  At that point I knew I was in for an actual breakfast event.     My wife ordered an omelette with applewood smoked bacon, avocado, spinach and mushrooms which included hash browns and biscuits.  The omelette was fluffy and generous, hash browns done perfectly, not greasy or under cooked, and the biscuits were split and then toasted with butter and incredibly tasty.     I had the skillet with chorizo sausage and ordered it extra greasy. It was stunningly fabulous.  I also ordered the biscuits but with an extra side of their gravy.  If you don't get anything else, which would be a mistake, get their breakfast gravy! My wife is from Alabama and she makes the best gravy,.....until I tasted this! Oh my!      I suggest you get there early on a Saturday morning and don't sit by the entrance on a cold day as the breezeway leaks air out the sides when anyone opens the door.     Other than that I'm coming again and again and again and again, and brining friends..........   :)  Brad & Linda

Tried this place on a Sunday morning after driving by it a bunch of times. First appearances were good. The place seems clean, not too busy and we were greeted nicely. I ordered the Breakfast Burrito. It was ok  but appeared to be just a very large omelette with bits of sausage and pieces of jalapeno wrapped in a tortilla and not very well seasoned. And when I say a large omelette, it had to be at least 4 eggs worth. I could barely finish it and I make myself 3 egg omelettes all the time. I would of preferred a more traditional breakfast burrito with scrambled eggs, meat, pico de gallo and cheese added in layers, not one large glob of egg. The hashbrowns werent good either, they were underseasoned as well. My girlfriend had a frittata, which was good. The ingredients were fresh. Our service was decent. Our server was nice . Although we did get our bill directly after receiving our food, which is a little odd. It seemed like that was it for him in taking care of us until we were don't eating and he came for the plates. We were also offered a coffee to-go, which never came. I wasn't that desperate for another coffee to make a fuss about it and find our server. I really want to like this place. I will give it a second chance and hope the experience is better.

The buffalo wrap here is amazing and a must have. I think it creates a new standard for buffalo wraps in chicago. They also have some pretty kick @$$ soups. I had the enchilada soup. Lets just say my mouth was one happy camper.

Had probably the worst breakfast experience of my adult life here- and that includes the Denny's and IHOPS of Rockford, IL. We waited for an hour to get food. Our plates were brought out at intervals. Mine first, my daughters second and my significant others was last- each seperated by several minutes. The waiter not only seemed to forget about us, but he acted like it was because they were busy (and they were but we watched multiple other people get seated and get their food while we waited without refills) and as if we should be ok with the wait. Do you need to be a regular here to be recognized? Can a place like this even gain regulars?It was rude.  The food came out half cold/half warm. We were in great moods and laughing when we came in, so I can't say that I thought there was any rude exchange here. Maybe it was when I ordered a special and the waiter corrected me with another special? I had to repeat myself and tell him that "no, the Athenian omelet was on the board as a special". He actually left our table to go check? But even that didn't seem too awkward at the time, just funny. I dunno- I can't suggest you go here for any reason at all.

Great food, great atmosphere, great server. I had Sebastian as my waiter the other day when I was in and can I say WOW was he great!! Attentive, funny, and made my time at Windy City very memorable. Next time I'm back I'm definitely going to request his section!

Love the food, the huge menu, servers and even the homely ambiance! People are so friendly and service is fast! ! I love everything I have had so far. Absolute fan of their Caramel Apple Pancakes and skillets. Conveniently located right off the Chicago Blue Line stop. Love everything about this place! A must try.

I had the Club 1 with sausage. It was delicious. Service was great and the food came out quick. This place is very cozy. Everything you want in a breakfast diner joint. I will definitely be back here to try some other items on the menu.

Really nice place, busy with the locals on a Saturday morning, singles, couples, people with kids, waitresses were hopping.  The service was great, friendly and prompt, got water and the refill on coffee.  The breakfast menu is pretty large, should be something for everyone on there.  Several different versions of eggs benny, and I went with the corned beef hash benedict.  one egg was slightly over-poached, but it was still entirely serviceable and the food was really tasty, plenty of it too.  I just want to address, for a moment, that school of thought out there that slams corned beef hash as looking like dog food.  Which it does, certain US brands of dog food anyway.  But it tastes great and wonderfully pairs with eggs.  And most dogs would consider it a lucky day indeed to get a big dish of corned beef hash.  More to the point, most dogs would tell you that anything edible looks like dog food to them.  Regardless, the corned beef benny was great outside of the one slightly overdone egg.  Hollandaise tasted great.  Tasted like it was made from scratch, and the dish was properly sauced too, not drowning but not skimping, enough to go around.  Hash had a nice crust on it too, nice touch, shows some thought there.  I've had corned beef hash in some places show up as a hot soggy lump, but this dish was well put together.  Coffee was good.  It's a rock-solid three stars, hard to imagine a meal going wrong here, and I'll definitely stop in here next time I'm in the neighborhood and then I'll re-rate this to 4 stars.  St. John Cantius, one of the finest Polish churches in the city, is just down the street on Carpenter, so you can get yourself all churched up prior to or after your meal.

Had a wonderful lunch Sunday here. Burgers could be cooked longer though. I asked for well done but there was still pink in my burger. The water was served in a carafe which was nice, and I enjoyed the black tea that was served, with a small tea pot of hot water.
Good food. Nice service. Great neighborhood cafe. Nuff said.

We have been customers for the past 5 years and dine for breakfast here 3 times a month. The owners are great! The staff is welcoming, accommodating and eager to please. No lack of smiles or greetings both on your way in & out. Food is great! They make it anyways you want without hesitation. parking lot is wonderful for easy in and out. The updates the children (who now run) have made are bright and cheery!

Monday 9/9/2013, my husband and I decided to take the 45 minute drive and arrived at Windy city cafe around 12:45 pm. We were seated right away. I  ordered a veggie omelet, my husband ordered a gypsy skillet. While waiting I decided to order coffee.  My coffee was luke warm,  but I drank anyway.  After waiting 30 minutes, we asked what was the problem since the restuarant was not crowded and the waitress explained the all the cooks had walked out the past Sunday.. She explained the manager and the bus boy was trying to get out all the orders. I asked for more coffee and the second cup was cold. This time I asked for hot coffee and Im getting upset after waiting 45 minutes for our food. Finally our order came and my omelet was horrible, it was so overcooked I took two bites and quit. My husbands skillet was excellent. Thats the only reason I gave two stars. The waitress tried to make it right by offering to give me something different,  but I declined,  thinking maybe another order would take another 45 minutes. Sorry that was our first and will be our last time there.

Hands down the most INCREDIBLE breakfast! The coffee is GREAT and comes from Big Shoulders Coffee from across the street! The staff is WONDERFUL! We are traveling and had several bags but they took care of us! FANTASTIC service! AWESOME food at a great price! You will leave with a doggy bag and VERY stuffed! Now we have returned from our trip and we are passing through Chicago on Fathers Day and this place was my choice to eat! Again we have several suit cases and they helped us out. Being Fathers Day it's very busy and they felt we had waited to long for our order and gave us a 20% discount! This place ROCKS and the staff is AWESOME! Give it a try! You will LOVE it!

Absolutely LOVE this little neighborhood jem that is right off the Blue Line Chicago stop. Wonderful choice of breakfast and lunch items. The wait staff is quite helpful and knowledgeable on their menu. The prices are a touch on the pricey side, but you get a lot of food. I highly recommend going there for breakfast. Make sure you admire the photographs on the wall, their spectacular!!! The only issue I have is with the parking. There isn't much, but it's worth the hassle finding a spot.
I eat here all the time with clients and the servers and owners are great. The food is good and parking is easy in back. Solid place.

Generic name, but still a great little neighborhood breakfast and lunch spot off of the Blue Line.  Blindly you'd probably be able to guess almost every single item on the menu. They do eggs, waffles, pancakes, sandwiches, and everything else you'd imagine a neighborhood diner to be doing. All pretty tasty, but personally I go with their huevos rancheros. They're pretty legit.  The price point isn't Denny's but you're definitely getting better quality, hot coffee, and super friendly service which is always worth a couple extra bucks.

We went here for breakfast a few weeks ago. We arrived on a Saturday morning at around 10:00 a.m. and were immediately seated.  I ordered the vegetarian omelet with shredded potatoes and (thinking the portion size would be small) a short stack of pancakes. The omelet was huge and the "short stack" of pancakes could have been a meal in itself. The two pancakes that were part of the short stack were huge. Needless to say, as hard as I tried, I was unable to finish the entire meal.  The omelet was very good, as were the shredded potatoes. The pancakes were fantastic. They had a great buttermilk flavor that was enhanced with the maple syrup. These were definitely some of the best pancakes I have ever eaten. My girlfriend got a different omelet (can't remember which one) and pancakes as well. She also enjoyed her meal very much. The service was excellent. Our waitress was very friendly and checked in on us often. If you want great breakfast food and great service, stop in at Windy City Cafe. Your stomach will thank you.

Myself and three coworkers stopped in here to for lunch today to give it a try, and we were all very pleasently surprised. We walked in and were immediately greeted and seated, and for someone who is on a time crunch for lunch, that's a big deal. Our waitress was fast and courteous, and the menu offered many good choices. I had a chicken cesar wrap with fries, both of which were really tasty. All the food came out quickly, and everyone enjoyed what they ordered. They came back with the check quickly, and even accomodated us splitting the check three ways. This will definitely become a regular work lunch spot. The breakfast looked pretty good too.

There was no wait because I went fairly early, which was nice. I had the healthy club breakfast. It was a little pricey (and not that healthy honestly), but the food was good. The eggs were a little over cooked, and I could have used more fruit, but it's a good diner overall.

I just needed a quick filling healthy breakfast. I chose the one egg w/ choice of hash browns and sausages w/ whole wheat toast. The sausages were nice and plump and the eggs were tasteful. I'd go here again and try other items on the menu.

This is one of my favorite places to go for brunch. All of their servers are super personable. I love the food variety. The Edgar's Skillet is my usual dish, although sometimes I've gone for the Stuffed French Toast when my sweet tooth is calling me. Coffee is delicious, food is served super quick. Reasonable prices. It's rare when we have to wait for a seat (usually when we do, it's because the area church just got out). I highly recommend this place for the quality of food AND service!

I was very impressed with this place.  I didn't expect to be impressed just by judging it's size from the outside walking in.  I just thought it was another average small corner cafe.  What we got was so much more. I was in the neighborhood visiting a friend, we decided we wanted brunch on a Monday.  Saw this place on yelp, and liked what I saw when I glanced at menu and reviews so we decided to give it a try. Modern but comfortable and relaxed interior.  Simple, but nice to look at.  Creative menu-board up front. Server was nice, attentive, cute personality.  Never had an empty glass, didn't even have to ask for my hot sauce.  Nicely done. Menu was surprising for the size of this place.  Lots of choices, but its not JUST quantity, it's quality too!  Even a red-velvet french toast made out of their red-velvet doughnuts!  Creative choices all around. The food I ordered, Corned Beef Hash Benedict, was great!  Perfectly portioned, amazing price.  My only critique would be the hollandaise sauce.  Not surprising as I'm VERY picky about my hollandaise.  It has to be a PERFECT balance of the butter and lemon flavors.  Many places tend to lean too far in one direction or the other.  In this case, it was just a tad too far on the lemon side, but still good enough for me to eat. I checked in on Yelp when I was there, and they gave me a free red velvet doughnut!  It was AMAZING! I love The Windy City Cafe, and will definitely be returning!

I can't believe I haven't reviewed this place before!  We have breakfast here often. They have great service, its bright and clean, and solid food.  Just what you want on a Sunday.  Nothing fancy although they've been adding specials, turkey bacon, chicken sausage and veggie sausage.  Omelets with avocados!  You can get it all.  Good coffee too!   They also have some parking in the back and its easy to street park. This is an easy breezy breakfast staple if you're not looking for fru-fru.
I love this place.  No greasy spoon here, rather a balance between hash brown goodness and healthy choices. Fun and friendly people. Am a regular.

Took my family of seven for Sunday late breakfast / brunch.  Friendly staff.  Yummy breakfasts: kids had waffles or pancakes, omelets.  I had huevos rancheros.  Two things stand out: they didn't look horrified at the site of kids walking in; and their coffee is quite good--it's usually awful in diners.
