Excellent neighborhood diner for breakfast and lunch.  They are extremely friendly and the food is tops.  The steak and eggs were fabulous and they give generous portions.  The place is clean and organized and the decor is standard diner looking.

This place is not very great, but it's not bad either.  They have great service, but I still feel like management should've done something about the fact that my side of fruit came with a bad strawberry (there was some fungus in it, you know that green and white fluffy stuff that grows on the fruit skin?) Sometimes I try to understand these things, after all these places are busy and they do offer quick service... but this is no excuse to be up to date about the quality of food used in your restaurant...despite the fact it is a side dish or not. The waitress was a sweetheart and she apologized, but nothing else was done about that and I had full price charged. Place is nice and cozy and close to our house.  The red velvet donut was yumi!

I heard really good things about this place and decided to try it on a Wednesday afternoon. I wanted to start with a pastry or cinnamon roll or the like and everything I tried to order they were out of. Sure, maybe I don't need any more sugar in my life but that's not their decision to make! Harumph. I ended up picking the spartan omelet. It was alright. It was a bit under seasoned, as expected, and nothing really special. But it was a large portion and cooked properly. Status quo for an omelet. The menu is huge, and a lot to choose from but not really anything to go out of your way for.

Nice cozy cafe right off the Chicago/Milwaukee blue line stop.  I thought it was cool that they serve coffee from Big Shoulders cafe, which is right across the street from them.  The food was good, service was good, and we got a free red velvet donut for checking in on yelp lol.

Had lunch at the Windy City Cafe today. I liked it... Think modern diner. I had the Southwest Skillet which was perfect.  The chorizo was muy authentico and the food was still hot when it was served. And as it turns out there was tons of street parking so my anxiety over potentially not finding a spot was unfounded. I ended up feeling so relaxed here that I was there for 1.5 hours. I can't think of anything funny to write so I'll just talk about something else.  My bout of conjunctivitis is finally over!  Looks like I will avoid wearing contacts a while to give my eyes a break.

The pictures on Yelp are accurate, this place has an extensive menu and the prices are reasonable.  I would go to this place first over Johnny's Snack Shop, Brunch, Yolk, and Flo.  Since I'm an early riser, my only complaint is that they open at 8am on weekends.  Best bet is the skirt steak and eggs.  I'ved had this on 2 occasions, the steak was juicy and had not fat.  Parking (meter) is very easy and the ambience is a typical 80's diner.

Pleasantly surprised! I took a peek at the menu on Yelp and seemed pretty standard fare.  I parked in the lot around back ( a betch to get out of btw), and walked in to what looked to be an empty restaurant.  That's because I didn't see the other half! There were a few diners there and we snagged a booth. The menu is huge, people!  The wonderful thing about it is all the healthy options available. I am cutting carbs and was so glad to see the wonderful options available to me.  I went with the Spartan Omelette which was absolutely delicious. It had spinach, mushrooms, tomato and plenty of feta cheese.  I ate the whole thing! I also ordered a side of fresh fruit instead of those dreaded (but delicious) carby hash browns. There was a nice assortment and it was all fresh.  I will definitely return soon but I do have to make note that the counter lady was being totally inappropriate.     I can clearly hear her complaining about other staff "standing around doing nothing" while she then proceeded to lean on the counter and play/text on her phone. For realz, chick. Slow your roll. If you need to reprimand an employee, do so discreetly and not where patrons can hear you.

yummo! lots of healthy options! i had 2 eggs with chicken sausage, an english muffin and i subbed the hashbrowns for cottage cheese. the chicken sausage was like the tomato basil ones from trader joe's and they poached my eggs perfectly, so good.  my bf had the edgars skillet which was also good. the food was just well cooked and not too greasy, i don't like feeling like i have eaten an entire days worth of calories before noon. our server was also super nice, it's great to have another place in the neighborhood that serves great breakfast/diner food without some kind of "flare" to it or that is super overpriced. sometimes you just want old school, good breakfast, and that's what you're going to get here

Not a bad first experience, friendly waitstaff, correctly prepared food, and inviting atmosphere. :)  I'd definitely go back and try other fair.    Today I had the farmers omlet and coffee.  Truth be told... eggs are one of the most basic and difficult foods to prepare.  I was happy they weren't over cooked, dry, tinged green or gray, or runny, haha!!! YES, I've had my share of bad eggs.  Thanks for being a success Windy City Café. ^_^

Delicious fresh squeezed strawberry OJ. Nice omlettes, lots of delicious looking French toast. Pretty reasonably priced, too. Will be going back for sure. Wait on a Saturday at about noon wasn't bad at all, either.

Always great!  I live nearby and this cafe is always a great local option. The staff are pleasant and attentive, everything I've tried is prepared just as I requested and the food is tasty.  Even when they are busy the food comes out pretty quick!

used to be a favorite, ate breakfast there every Sat am- then they changed coffee to bland hot water variety and cut back to only one piece of toast with the skillets.  Also raised prices, I would pay the higher price but cheap coffee and one piece of toast means i am not going back.
GREAT service.. I never went with more then a half empty glass of anything  Chocolate chip pancakes were to die for.. there is so much more to try This a great find and I will be back

i've been wanting come here forever (with high expectations nonetheless) and i wasn't disappointed :) cute little cafe and the service was awesome.  chit-chatted with the server, who was super cool and helpful.  loved her.  the old photographs of chicago and of the blue line being rebuilt are dope.   i ordered the Pope-yes scramble, and subbed the mozz for feta cheese.  it was yum.  eggs were cooked well.  the fritrata came out more omelet-y like - i guess i was expecting it to be in a contained space of some sort.   i check-in thru yelp all the time, so when i did, i was rewarded a free choc chip cookie.  but, unfortunately, they stopped making them and only had cookies with nuts in them (which i am allergic).  so instead i got a red velvet donut, which was basically heaven all up in my mouth.  it was a cake donut, which was even awesomer.  score. will be back, for shiz.

Windy City is my favorite brunch restaurant in the neighborhood. The food is reasonably priced (everything is in the $6-9 range for a meal). The specials are unstoppable and they change quite frequently so the menu is never stale. The portions are generous, as well. The staff is so accommodating and friendly. Expect to never see the bottom of your glass or mug. Food and check come quick. The restaurant atmosphere is what you'd expect from a diner in the suburbs. Chicago is really good at taking a novel idea, such as brunch, and sensationalizing it by serving everything on square plates and in oversized, trendy shot-glasses. This place is not that. If you were kidnapped, placed in this diner, and forced to answer one question for your freedom: Are you at a restaurant in the city? You would not be set free. I can't think of one bad thing to say about this place.

I have been wanting to try this place, but could not make it before 3 until just recently. The restaurant is nice inside with a spacious seating area and ample wait staff. The portions were smaller than expected, but not small enough to elicite a complaints. Despite being left wanting more, I must admit the pricing was fair, the food was good, and the service was attentive-- a little too attentive as the waitress took my plate before I was finished. While this place didn't wow me, I plan to return for a simple, affordable, no frills breakfast.
excellent service,food,price.clean as a whistle,& easy access...always eat brkfst with my family @ wcc  when in the city....

Always have passed up this place. Not sure why because my first experience here today was fantastic. Staff, awesome. Food, awesome. Location, awesome. In fact, I'm still here hanging out for the Chicago bus on a 100 degree day. Had the oatmeal with bananas,  comes with brown sugar and milk on the side, and a side order of sausage. Delish!

P gud food and prices, got the Big Tuna (tuna salad sandwich) and it came with fries but they let me substute with a bowl of legit fruit,  Only problem was with the service, dey were tryn 2 mov tables rly fast so dey took away my plate while there was still 1/6th a sandwich on der while I had gotten up, dey brought it bk, but it was moved to a wet plate thus tasted slightly wet thereafter

Work in the area and this is a good solid lunch spot.  Fries are hit or miss, but when they are on, they are good.  Good sandwiches, decent breakfast (hashbrowns need work), and everything is decently prices.  Wouldn't travel across country for the food, but I never have trouble agreeing to lunch here when I'm in the neighborhood.

Chicago takes breakfast pretty seriously. I doubt Windy City Cafe is going to win a James Beard award, but this place is solid. I've visited numerous times and I have found the food to be very good, service is friendly and attentive, and the prices very reasonable.  If you are looking for a new breakfast place, try this one.

I visited the Windy City Cafe for the first time this past week with my sister and her boyfriend, who are weekly regulars to this location.  I understand why they go each week.  It is AMAZING!  Whether or not you use the Yelp deal to get a free cookie, make sure to buy one, because I have never had such a great cookie. I can't remember the exact name of the omlette, but it had bacon, cheese and avocado to name a few ingredients. It was REALLY tasty. I did try some of my sister's oatmeal, which was amazing.  It makes me so jealous that I am not able to mimic the recipe and make my daily oatmeal nearly as tasty. The staff is all very friendly, and the location is such a nice area.

My son's regular french toast was plentiful and outstanding. I had the BLT on cracked wheat bread and it was fabulous! Menu is long, but everything I saw coming out of the kitchen looked really tasty. Service was very timely and waitress was attentive. However, sad to say it is only open until 3pm. Bummer.

Love this place and they were open on Jan 1st and fixed the hangover pretty well. Classic diner worth the wait on weekends and even better on weekdays when you sit right down and order. Love the skillet dishes and they always get everything just right. When u want "almost black" hash browns they get it. Staff really cool too!

Extremly convienent location, right off the Chicago Blue Line stop. Tasty food with affordable prices, friendly service, a good coffee. Try the egg white omlette...any variety, but choose egg whites.....Windy City makes the fluffy and delicious. The next time I come here I will be having the Whole Wheat Wafflet....sounds good and slightly less sinful that your traditional waffle. Excited. Important to note that the service is quick and the food is always hot.

We've been here several time and it's about time I write a review.  I usually get an omelet here.  And they are consistently big, fluffy and flavorful.  They also have some special pancakes and french toast creations that are really good.  What is a plus is that you don't have to endure the lines you'll find at River North places like Yolk and Meli's.  Just about a mile west of River North and plenty of street (although metered) parking available on the dead end street just east of Windy City.  Try it out, you'll like it.

My new favorite breakfast place. I live right down the street and pass it all the time going to the blue line but never bothered to go inside.  Just keep in mind this place is breakfast and lunch only so it closes at 3pm everyday. I was craving some good breakfast or lunch so I decided to try this place out. I ended up getting the hamburger because it was a little to late for me to eat breakfast. And the burger was really good. I love their fries.  The service here is really nice and friendly. They make you feel at home. So kudos to the boss for hiring them. And if you check in on yelp you get a free chocolate chip cookie.

Excellent quality food at reasonable prices.  Always have great & friendly service too.  Within walking distance of where we live so it's a new favorite neighborhood spot.  I have never had lunch here but pancakes & omelettes for breakfast are great!

I came across this place on accident actually, after walking blocks and blocks and blocks while shopping, I was super happy to get out of the cold and to get some warm food in my belly. Totally worth it! I found a table right away and the waitress couldn't have been friendlier. I got "The Spartan" omelette; spinach, mushrooms, tomatoes, and feta, a side of hash browns, and some rye toast. They gave me marble rye! I was so excited, I had a Seinfeld moment. The omelette, words can't even describe how good it was, I put a little hot sauce on it and it was se maqnifique! My niece got the oatmeal with bananas and brown sugar, she love it. They must have asked me at least 5 times if I wanted more coffee..bonus points there. I highly recommend if you're ever in the Chicago area.

I've eaten here several times. Their menu has pretty much any option you could want (except they don't have vanilla ice cream to put on top of waffles). I also wish they were open later in the day.  It has more of a healthy bent than a greasy spoon. The service was reasonable and average.
Great food, great staff, only open until 3 pm daily

So work has brought me to Chicago a few times over the summer/fall and the office is nearby which means that I've had the pleasure of several lunches here. The services has always been good even when they were very busy.  I was impressed with the cheerful and joking attitude of our server.  She seemed to genuinely be glad to be there serving us.  Any place with a happy employee is good in my book. Now, on to what made my taste buds happy. I'm not really a huge sandwich fan but the cuban here is fantastic.  It makes me wish I could duplicate it at home.  The Reuben is also a fantastic sandwich option.  This is an eat with your fork sandwich though.  If you attempt to eat this one with your hands, you'll be wearing some of it for the rest of the day-not that there's anything wrong with that!  It's probably worth it! If you're in the mood for some old school diner food, stop in.  I don't think you'll be disappointed.

Sometimes you just want a good cup of coffee and some eggs. I live downtown where the average wait for brunch is 40 minutes. Although i love some of those spots, I love windy city even more.  Great food, nice service, quick. What else could you ask for? The omelets are delish and the salads are awesome. They don't rush you out and are always thanking you for coming by. Love. this. place. PERIOD

This is a perfect neighborhood breakfast spot.  The food is good, the staff is very friendly and you never wait more then 15 minutes for your food.  My only complaint is that is can be drafty in the winter time.

The food here is very well rounded with both heavy meals and light options and there is rarely a wait. My boyfriend and I love. Coming here to try their sweet specials and jam to the classic music. The wait staff is always a delight and hasn't made a mistake or had to apologize for any untimely mishaps.. we love it here. Even if he didn't live down the street this would be on the list of morning eat-outs. Their cinnamon roll is divine!

Want to know what's annoying? Waiting 45 minutes+ for a simple breakfast that is normally overrated. Windy City Cafe is a great alternative. You will never have to wait, the food is great, and the service is extremely good. If you drive, there is ample parking around the restaurant, which is extremely convenient.  I honestly recommend this place to anyone looking to avoid the trendy downtown breakfast/brunch scene. You will be impressed, I promise.

I think I have now learned what to order and not what to order at the Windy City Cafe. For on my most recent visit- they pulled everything off pretty flawlessly.  My omelet was perfect, the toast was warm and buttery (with plenty of jam packets on the table for me to smear on it) and my friend's steak and eggs (over easy) put a smile on his face!  I think simplicity if the key here. Huge portions that don't cost an arm and a leg, this time all served up by a ever so "perky" woman who obviously likes mornings better than me. And there is rarely a wait, even on a Sunday morning.  Thanks Windy City Cafe. You've saved my mornings time and time again!
I love this place, it's close to where I live and is always the go to breakfast spot. The food is good, service is great and I will keep coming back!

I've been to this cafe twice: Once to get a decent meal before work and the second time was for brunch with my 1 yr. old nephew.  The food was fresh and delicious, which is all you can ask of standard cafe/diner food.   The service was excellent both times and the bathroom was clean, all in all, a four star Diner!

When I was in high school at the Chicago Academy for the Arts, right down the street, I came here for lunch every day.  Yeah, I was 17 and lived with my mom, but I also had a full time job and a disposable income just burning a hole in my pocket.  What I wouldn't give to go back to those days.  No bills, constant money, and strawberry waffles on a daily basis.  Tons of cash, no bills, and a lightning fast metabolism - that was the life. I know they liked us, even if all we did was smoke cigarettes and drink coffee, because we always ate and we always tipped (I was aa 17 year old waitress, after all).  Therefore, I have nothing but fond memories of Windy City.  Now that I actually live in the neighborhood, I've been back a few times, and I still like it, for what it's worth.  It's still a diner with spotty service, and it's a little overpriced (see: Salonica) for what it is, but it's still got a special place in my heart.

Finally a breakfast place that just has regular old fashioned pancakes, eggs, and meat (all of which my boyfriend has been stressing for quite some time). I was looking for a diner that served a late breakfast because we had plans on getting massages in the early afternoon randomly on a Wednesday and didn't want to eat a heavy breakfast before. So we needed a place with breakfast options around 1pm. I found this place on Yelp searching for traditional American options, as he complains about not having the basics at some other places I've taken him to in the city. I personally have other favorite breakfast/lunch venues of my own, however he seemed to really like this place so I am giving it a great review from his "steak and potatoes man" perspective.  He had the linebacker omelet with cheese and sausage, bacon, pecan waffles, and a side of fruit and toast (my boo likes to eat lol)  I had the The Spartan omelet with egg white spinach and feta, wheat toast, and hash browns. All the food was yummy, but the omelets were a little much. Just way too much egg for me. I know it said 3 but there had to be like 6 in there for sure. I probably got through 1/4 of it. Simple menu, good portions, reasonably priced. My only complaint was there was really no parking. Most of the surrounding blocks are permit so we had to park a few blocks down and cut through an alley. Considering it's a Wednesday afternoon I can only imagine what it's like on a Saturday. Also, this place is small, only about 10 - 12 tables. Therefore if if it's a peak time I recommend carryout.

This is the first place I went for breakfast when I originally moved to the city. Five years later, it's one of my regular spots. Windy City is a great little diner with high quality food and wonderful service. The waitresses are chipper and always fast. One of my favorites.

Pretty good. The food is greasy, but it's a diner. I like the biscuits and gravy. The thick diner mugs are good too. The waitresses have all been really cool and friendly as well. Great place for hangover food or to meet up with some friends on the weekend. It's a nice down-to-earth alternative to the upscale brunch places in Chicago.

Totally accomodating of the fact that we walked in 4 minutes before the kitchen closed (didn't know they were only open til 3), and the server was super nice.  Got dinner for two for under $20, which doesn't happen everyday.  Like one yelper said ... very dineresque, but hey, I can't complain about my grilled cheese and fries.  Good stuff.

Yum yum! This is my new favorite place. I had been here once before but I was not happy with my service.  A lady waited on us, I can't remember her name but she reeked of booze and smoke! Anyhow bringing you up to date, we received a coupon in the mail and decided to give it one more chance.  As soon as we walked in a girl told us we could sit anywhere we wanted...sweet...we love picking our seat. She came right up with menus and water, then she informed us of the specials, they all sounded tasty but we stuck with menu items.  The food came out soooooo fast! I only had time to take one sip of my coffee.  The food was delish.  The service was even better!!! Our waitress kept all our drinks filled, made sure the table stayed clean and even boxed our leftovers up.  This is not what I expected from a diner. Totally pleased!!! Oh and not to mention the "get a free breakfast" coupon! I also noticed the nice artwork of Chicago on their back wall and the waitress was telling me about all the changes that they have been making.  I asked for her name and told her we would be back to see her...then the bad news came...she told us she only serves a few days a week and that she works the counter....bummer....But we will be back...

One of the best breakfast spots in the city of Chicago. You can come here on the craziest Sunday morning and still get a seat almost instantly. The service is attentive and fast. You'll get your order faster at Windy City than any other diner I've been to. The breakfasts here are very good. Your standard American breakfast, nothing fancy, but the staples are great. I come here at least once a month and am always satisfied. I did try lunch here once, and didn't much care for it, so for me this place is breakfast only. But it's a straight up breakfast favorite.
Service great, food great. Stopped by this week and ordered a 'gypsy skillet', wow.  It was absolutely fantastic. They also serve very generous proportions.

Good place that you will not have to wait to get into for breakfast.  They offer take out too if you cant get yer other half to get her ass out of bed and walk over there. The food is really nothing special, but I will take it over CTAing it to other places and waiting.  Have had one egg dish that was messed up, but in the 5-6 times I have eaten there, it has been pretty good otherwise.  The ladies that run the show are all really nice diner types, not the bitchy attitudes that are all the rage at some of the other local places - WTF, I just want breakfast! Try it out - its low key and their menu is substantial...
Good classic Ameircan food, friendly service, very reasonable prices. More upmarket than a greasy spoon, while still casual & low-key.

Reliable diner fare! No waiting! Credit accepted!  Though I love, love, love the Palace Grill...the truth is, sometimes it gets crazy crowded on prime weekend breakfast hours, and they only take cash. Usually after a night of drinking I have neither patience nor cash...so I seek alternatives.  Windy City Cafe is quite a good one, if I do say. It's not gonna blow your damn mind, but that's not what I'm seeking in a diner. I want buttery toast, eggy omelettes, and hot coffee.  This was served to me in short order! Tons of seating, no wait, friendly old doll of a waitress. Hot coffee, quick eggs., buttered toast WITH jelly. Clean tables. In and out, tummy full, caffeinated...and ready to roll. $28 + tip = breakfast for 2. Comparable to Palace grill, but the hash browns won't ever measure up. Sometimes that's the price you pay to charge it and sit quickly. VERY kid-friendly, too.  Stumblin' distance from the Chicago blue stop, fairly easy metered parking. Milwaukee bus.

I would avoid this place. First, they screwed up my order. I ordered a Turkey Panini, butternut squash soup, pesto chicken panini with fries, and a couple cokes. They completely forgot the cokes, and my pesto panini turned into a chicken caeser wrap.  The food was not good. The fries were soggy and limp. The wrap was quite boring. It seemed like nothing but some lettuce and overcooked chicken breast with Cesar dressing on the side. The Turkey panini looked pretty boring as well. All in all it was bland cafe fair. I thought it was a bit expensive as well. $9 for a wrap that bad is miles away from a good deal.

A decent run of the mill breakfast/lunch spot.  It's ok.  My friend seemed to LOVE the steak and eggs and from what I could see, the steak looked fantastic - not a piece of leather skirt steak.  Husband had the huevos rancheros...Gaudi's is better.  By a million.  I had the egg, ham, and cheese sandwich...For $6 it was ok...Probably trek back here again when it's nice out so we can walk but not somewhere that's on my list of frequents....

I went here for the first time today at about 2:30 not realizing they closed at 3 but ate regardless. The food was great and the waitress was very nice. I went to pay with my friend, and asked for seperate checks at the register because I forgot to ask prior to paying. Everything seemed fine. Then my friend went to the bathroom and I waited outside the door, where I then heard them loudly complaining about us because we asked for seperate checks and for using the bathroom before we left when they were closing. I would have said this place was great until this happened. This was completely unnecessary and ruined the entire experience. Next time you complain about someone, maybe you should make sure theyre out the door first. I will never go here again.
service was horrible, food was gross - too many great breakfast places/diners in chicago to pay this much money for a crappy meal.

This place is gross.  I really really wish it was better because we live so close.  Been here for breakfast several times and every time the food is greasy and disgusting.  After friends got sick off the food one day we stopped going completely.  I stop by for some take out coffee if I'm desperate but that's it.
Great service, good food at a reasonable price. The restaurant lacks WiFi, but that is not a dealbreaker.
Ewwwwwww.... Had the GAH-ROSSEST veggie burger here! It was slimy inside and outside.  Vomit.

I really have wanted to like the Windy City cafe more, but on two trips, I have to recommend taking a pass.  The first time I had a so-so sandwich which I felt was not worth the modest price paid.  Then I decided to give the cafe another try and arrived for a late weekend breakfast.  Ambience okay, service friendly and fast - so far, so good.  But breakfast - it is so easy to get right (or it should be) and yet this is what I experienced: lukewarm eggs although they were done correctly; barely toasted and almost cold toast; overly-salty blah bacon; hash browns that seemed homemade but were barely warmed through.  Mediocre coffee as well.  So maybe I should have immediately complained and ordered it all reheated - but I guess I think they should get something so simple right the first time.

I met someone here for a late lunch a few weeks ago and when I got there around 1, the place was empty, which usually is not a good sign.   The waitress was friendly and raved about the nachos and how I had to order the nachos.  She made a point of saying they had a Mexican chef and it was a Mexican kitchen so they were delicious.  Seeing how I eat sandwiches almost every day for lunch I figured I would go with her recommendation and have the nachos.  The food didn't take long to arrive and I was greeted with a heaping plate of nachos.  Sadly though, they did not live up to the hype.  The cheese was barely melted, the chips, which could have been homemade, were very oily.  The beef was overcooked, tasteless and dry.  None of the ingredients were fresh and it was a big disappointment.  I will say, the side of guac that came with it was pretty tasty and looked homemade, but it couldn't help save that train wreck on the plate.   I've heard good reviews from friends about this place, so I would try it again, but no more nachos for me.
Great little neighborhood diner that I have been coming to for almost 10 years. Nothing cures a hangover like this place.

This place is close to my house so I come here when I don't want to drive someplace better.   The waitress set down a couple little plates for our appetizers (nothing special mozzarella sticks) and there was a little pube-sized hair on my husband's plate.  Instead of taking the plate away, she took HER FINGER and dabbed away the hair.  Needless to say, he didn't use that plate.   It's a friendly place and ok food.  Nothing bad about it, nothing great.  And you can come in looking like shit and no one will judge you.

A cute little neighborhood diner spot! What really made this place stand out was the dynamite waitress who was serving our whole dining room flawlessly and friendly! Good tasty food, hot and fresh.  I loved the cinnimon roll. Make sure to ask for it warm!  Also, I LOVE their wheat toast. It's outstanding! It really stood out! I know saying you'd go back to a place for the TOAST is weird...but I totally would!!!  We went for breakfast and to pick up a quick salad on the way home from work. Great, fast service!

Windy City cafe is really good. I think what sets it apart from the rest is exceptional service. There's a waiter there, a mexican guy who is so on top of everything and every table, it's amazing. I always hope I get him. He goes out of his way to make sure that you like the food, and is so quick, he'll be back in a blink. The food isn't super special, but I go there because it's quick, convenient, and the mexican guy, he just seals the deal.

This place is a diner, they serve food, they are friendly. If you wanna read the paper next to the window, let the sunlight warm you up, watch the traffic go by, get lost in thought for a bit, drink orange juice and have some eggs benedict, I'd recommend Windy City Cafe.  Nothing will knock your socks off here, but I think that's part of the appeal. Like another reviewer said, a good, safe place to take your grandmother or mother or a good place to eat by yourself and not feel self-conscious.

Service was great! The menu is pretty basic and the prices are reasonable. I had an egg white omelet with veggies, toast and home fries. Gigantic portions served quickly. They had really good wheat bread. I would go back.

Breakfast all day, lots of choices, great service and reasonable prices... What more can you expect?? Good pancakes and eggs for your standard options, but also some good looking specials, caramel apple pancakes today!!! No complaints and full tummy's.

this is a good breakfast/lunch spot.  it's nothing fancy...standard omelets, egg and pancake stuff.  however, they also have a huge lunch menu.  everytime i go there i plan on having breakfast but then when i look at everything they have, i typically end up getting lunch.  they have super good fries.  we always have fantastic service by the same guy.  he is like a buddy, he shakes my boyfriends hand and is super attentive.  probably the reason why we just love to go back.  the coffee is good and the prices are very reasonable.  parking is pretty easy too.

If I could give it 3.5 stars I would... the service at Windy City is superb!  Your water glass will never be empty.  The food is pretty decent- nothing fancy but if you are wanting the typical breakfast then this place won't dissappoint.  The food comes out pretty fast as well which is nice.  It's also pretty cheap for the amount of food you get.  The only negative thing I can write about this place is that when you order toast it comes cold and they do not butter it for you so if you end up deciding to even eat it you will have to settle for a cold piece of butter on cold toast.  Also, not a fan of the hashbrowns there.

I have a friend who lives pretty close to that place so that is a usual Sat or Sunday brunch place for us.  Good food, service can be a little slow, but friendly staff and very reasonably priced. I like the place and will continue to patronize it.

A pleasant little place for breakfast.  Overpriced, but the service is good and the food is satisfying enough.  I'd head down to Swim Cafe if I had a choice, but Windy City Cafe'll do if you're stuck and in a hurry.

I come here often. This place has the diner appeal, but the food is better than your average greasy spoon. The skillets, omelets, pancakes everything tastes great. You must get the breakfast sausage links. Two big links that taste great. The breakfast I only come here for breakfast cannot vouch for lunch.

Randomly walked in the place on a weekend, there was only one other table occupied at that time. Ordered omelets, they were TASTELESS.   Will not return. Giving them 2 stars because the service was great and a manager lady came by and asked if everything was ok.
This place is great!  Their menu covers just about anything you would want  for breakfast or lunch. You will get more than you can eat, so come hungry.

I bike all the way from the Lake just to get to Windy City.  It is quiet and  unpretentious, with very good (but not excellent) food.   The thing that sets it apart is the *fantastic* service.  My water glass (and soda cup) are never left empty and my food arrives quickly.  My veggie omelet always has fresh vegetables and my salad is always fresh.   If you're looking for something with a "reduction", "aioli" or "demi-glace", go to somplace in Gold Coast.  If you want a diner where the waitress calls you "hon" and looks happy to see you, this is it.

I've been passing this place for the last year and a half. Been thinking I should try it for at least a year. It would have been better left to the imagination. Friendly service, but over priced for what I received. Not terrible food, but not worthy of a return visit, either. Oh, and the coffee, although it was hot, it was WEAK! I could see through the pot as it was poured.

I wanted a down-to-earth place for breakfast with my mother and grandmother when I picked them up from Union Station on Saturday morning.  This place fit the bill perfectly, and it wasn't even busy at 9:30am. They serve dinery sort of food with atmosphere a cut above a greasy spoon.  Service was very, very friendly and old-fashioned.  Big points for that.  Also, prices were very fair, bordering on cheap.  Think frittatas and breakfast skillets for about $7 and simpler dishes for a buck or two less. Food was fine.  My chicken fajita skillet was bland but generously portioned.  My mother and grandmother enjoyed their selections, although my mom said that her potatoes were cold.

Let's be honest with each other, Windy City Cafe.  A prince of a cafe, you are not.  But you're reliable, you're friendly, and you're cheap.  A great standby date.  Plus, this morning you treated us to a semi artery-clogging food coma. What happens when your roommate falls in love and strands you for the wilds of Uptown and her boyfriend's hood?  Roommate date nights fall by the wayside.  This morning, she took me out to make up for ignoring me in favor of her man (not that I'm jealous, but I do miss my roomie!).  We hopped on the new dating trend, or so the European versions of Glamour tell me.   We met  for breakfast. At 8am on a Tuesday morning, this place was almost deserted (unlike the weekends).  Our waiter was warm and friendly.  He even asked about our friends, who usually join us at the Cafe for brunch.  Without asking for it, he brought us our coffee and a plate of toast so that we could munch a little while reviewing the menu. We're not adventurous here, but then again, neither is the kitchen.  Nevertheless, the food is always served hot, portions are generous without overdoing it, and the taste does not disappoint.  I opted for the #2 special, made up of juice,  two buttermilk pancakes, my choice of two eggs (scrambled, please!) and either some bacon or some sausage.  My roommate got a cheese and sausage omelet.  This place knows how to do eggs.  My scramble was light and fluffy.  Yummy! Windy City Cafe left us feeling satisfied. Our tummies were full of sustenance and we promised each other to visit again soon.
Hooray! A diner near my house! If only they were 24 hours, I'd give them a 5. Service is decently fast, the people there are nice and its way better than the sub par stuff at Hollywood!

Lovely diner brunch.  Very convenient off the Chicago-Blue line stop.  We were seated immediately at around 11:30 am and they were very quick with drinks/refills on the coffee/water, you name it.  One big drawback was no milkshakes.  According to my dining partner this was a big blow, especially since it was a diner, and they were dissappointed. Food was typical fare, but they did it well.  Good portion sizes, selection, and even the cheesy dishes aren't too greasy.  We'll be back :)

Wife and I have been here twice since we moved to the neighborhood. The question when we left this past Saturday was "why did we go back?" This is a completely average diner with average food and average service. This last time I ordered an omelet and a bowl of fresh fruit. The "fresh" fruit included peaches from a can, some cantelope, and half a banana. This is all they can get that's in season?!?! My wife ordered french toast with "fresh" strawberries. The french toast were very dry and seemed like they had been sitting out a while and the "fresh" strawberries were the overly sweet kind that comes from a can of pie filling. The worst part for me though, and probably the #1 reason I won't go back is that the first cup of coffee was lukewarm and the second was the same. A diner that can't even serve good coffee isn't worth my time.

I had taken a walk and decide to have breakfast so in I went. I sat by the window and watched the traffic. Had steak and eggs and was very pleased with the fast service and well prepared steak. Coffee and water were always filled. The Kids were laughing and it was just a pleasant Sunday morning experience. Service was as good as it gets. I will be back.

I live in the burbs now and miss having my own local diner/breakfast place.  Got nostalgic this morning so I thought I'd write a review.  Been going to this place for close to 9 years.  It has nice owners, pro waitresses, it's clean, consistent, and I miss going to breakfast there on the weekends.  And they have parking in back, to boot.   Support local Mom & Pop shops!!!!

i'm givin' this place five stars cause whenever it's saturday or sunday morning and the breakfast urge strikes, Windy City is on the list of possibilities even if somewhere else is chosen. from the Health Special to the basic bacon, eggs and toast, there is nowhere else around that compares. hit it up, you won't be sorry.

A great location and quick service. The other reviews are right.  It's solid Chicago bfast food, nothing fancy.  But they pour coffee frequently, my omelet comes out hot and fluffy, service is swift and earnest.   I can't ask for more from a bfast joint, especially after I swore off any yuppie bfast brunch place that I have to wait more than 30 mins for a table.   Some weekday mornings, I call ahead for bfast to go.  Double park, run  in to pay, and voila!

so yummy! I had forgotten about this place until driving past it yesterday! They have great breakfasts - large portions at very reasonable prices; don't expect anything fancy, just good solid breakfast food.  The wait is not very long either, particularly by Chicago brunch standards.  One of the owners, an adorable older gentleman, chatted us up while we waited and came by our table a few times to check up on us.  The only issue we had was parking in this neighborhood- but we parked in back (not sure if that was legal!) and didn't get towed, woohoo!

You know how sometimes you just want greasy breakfast food?  No place does it greasier and tastier and more economically friendly than the Windy City Cafe.  I mean, my gosh, fresh squeezed orange juice for under 3 bucks?  Good luck finding that elsewhere! The only downside is that this place is never open late.  If it had better hours, then it would be 5 stars no problem.
